member.name: T:VRDR.CodeSystems
member.summary: Single definitions for CodeSystem OIDs and URLs used throughout.

member.name: T:VRDR.DeathRecord
member.summary: Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting (VRDR) Death Record. This class was designed to help consume and produce death records that follow the HL7 FHIR Vital Records Death Reporting Implementation Guide, as described at: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr and https://github.com/hl7/vrdr.

member.name: F:VRDR.DeathRecord.Navigator
member.summary: Useful for navigating around the FHIR Bundle using FHIRPaths.

member.name: F:VRDR.DeathRecord.Bundle
member.summary: Bundle that contains the death record.

member.name: F:VRDR.DeathRecord.Composition
member.summary: Composition that described what the Bundle is, as well as keeping references to its contents.

member.name: F:VRDR.DeathRecord.StateDocumentReference
member.summary: DocumentReference that is used to specify state local death record identifier.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifiedTime
member.value: time when the record was certified.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.RegisteredTime
member.value: time when the record was registered.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertificationRole
member.value:
the role/qualification of the person who certified the death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> role = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertificationRoleHelper
member.value:
the role/qualification of the person who certified the death.
"code" - the code

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.InterestedPartyIdentifier
member.value:
the interested party identification. A Dictionary representing a system (e.g. NPI) and a value, containing the following key/value pairs:
"system" - the identifier system, e.g. US NPI
"value" - the identifier value, e.g. US NPI number

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> identifier = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.InterestedPartyName
member.value: an interested party name string.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.InterestedPartyAddress
member.value:
Interested Party's address. A Dictionary representing an address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.InterestedPartyType
member.value:
the interested party type. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> type = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.MannerOfDeathType
member.value:
the manner of death type. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> manner = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.MannerOfDeathTypeHelper
member.value:
the manner of death type
"code" - the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> manner = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.value: the certifier's name (first, middle, etc.)

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierFamilyName
member.value: the certifier's family name (i.e. last name)

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierSuffix
member.value: the certifier's suffix

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierAddress
member.value:
the certifier's address. A Dictionary representing an address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierQualification
member.value:
the certifier qualification. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> qualification = new Dictionary<string, string>();
qualification.Add("display", "Physician certified and pronounced death certificate");

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierIdentifier
member.value:
the certifier identification. A Dictionary representing a system (e.g. NPI) and a value, containing the following key/value pairs:
"system" - the identifier system, e.g. US NPI
"value" - the idetifier value, e.g. US NPI number

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> identifier = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CertifierLicenseNumber
member.value: A string containing the certifier license number.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ContributingConditions
member.summary: Significant conditions that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause. Corresponds to part 2 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value: A string containing the significant conditions that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause captured by a CauseOfDeathCondition.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CausesOfDeath
member.summary: Conditions that resulted in the cause of death. Corresponds to part 1 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Conditions that resulted in the underlying cause of death. An array of tuples (in the order they would appear on a death certificate, from top to bottom), each containing the cause of death literal (Tuple "Item1") the approximate onset to death (Tuple "Item2"), and an (optional) Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Tuple.Create("Example Immediate COD", "minutes", new Dictionary<string, string>(){ {"code", "1234"}, {"system", "example"} }),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 1", "2 hours", new Dictionary<string, string>()),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 2", "6 months", new Dictionary<string, string>()),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 3", "15 years", new Dictionary<string, string>())

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1A
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line a.
member.value: the immediate cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1A
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line a.
member.value: the immediate cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CODE1A
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Code, Line a.
member.value:
the immediate cause of death coding. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();
code.Add("display", "Acute transmural myocardial infarction of anterior wall");

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.COD1B
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I, Line b.
member.value: the first underlying cause of death literal.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.INTERVAL1B
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Interval, Line b.
member.value: the first underlying cause of death approximate interval: onset to death.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.CODE1B
member.summary: Cause of Death Part I Code, Line b.
member.value:
the first underlying cause of death coding. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.Residence
member.value:
Decedent's Residence. A Dictionary representing residence address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ResidenceWithinCityLimits
member.summary: Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits.
member.value:
Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> within = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.ResidenceWithinCityLimitsBoolean
member.summary: Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits. This is a convenience method, to access the coded value use ResidenceWithinCityLimits.
member.value: Decedent's residence is/is not within city limits. A null value means "not applicable".

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.SSN
member.value: the decedent's social security number, without dashes.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.EthnicityText
member.value: the decedent's ethnicity as a text string. Use the Ethnicity property to set coded ethnicity.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.Ethnicity
member.value: the decedent's ethnicity. An array of tuples, where the first value of each tuple is the display value, and the second is the code. Use the EthnicityText property to set this value as a simple string, setting the value of this property will create a default value for the EthnicityText property by concatenating the supplied code display texts.

example.para: Tuple<string, string>[] ethnicity = { Tuple.Create("Non Hispanic or Latino", "2186-5"), Tuple.Create("Salvadoran", "2161-8") };

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.RaceText
member.value: the decedent's race as a text string. Use the Race property to set coded race.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.Race
member.value: the decedent's race. An array of tuples, where the first value of each tuple is the display value, and the second is the code. Use the RaceText property to set this value as a simple string, setting the value of this property will create a default value for the RaceText property by concatenating the supplied code display texts.

example.para: Tuple<string, string>[] race = { Tuple.Create("Non Hispanic or Latino", "2186-5"), Tuple.Create("Salvadoran", "2161-8") };

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.PlaceOfBirth
member.value:
decedent's Place Of Birth. A Dictionary representing residence address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.value:
the marital status of the decedent at the time of death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.value:
the marital status of the decedent at the time of death.:

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.MorticianIdentifier
member.value:
the mortician identification. A Dictionary representing a system (e.g. NPI) and a value, containing the following key/value pairs:
"system" - the identifier system, e.g. US NPI
"value" - the idetifier value, e.g. US NPI number

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> identifier = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.FuneralHomeAddress
member.value:
the funeral home address. A Dictionary representing an address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.FuneralHomeName
member.value: the funeral home name.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.FuneralDirectorPhone
member.value: the funeral director phone number.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.DispositionLocationAddress
member.value:
the disposition location address. A Dictionary representing an address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"addressLine1" - address, line one
"addressLine2" - address, line two
"addressCity" - address, city
"addressCounty" - address, county
"addressState" - address, state
"addressZip" - address, zip
"addressCountry" - address, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> address = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.DispositionLocationName
member.value: the displosition location name.

member.name: P:VRDR.DeathRecord.DecedentDispositionMethod
member.value:
the decedent's disposition method. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code
"system" - the code system this code belongs to
"display" - a human readable meaning of the code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> dmethod = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.summary: If the related property is a Dictionary, the key name.

member.summary: Describes a FHIR path that can be used to get to the element.

member.summary: Property attribute used to describe a field in the IJE Mortality format.

member.name: F:VRDR.IJEField.Contents
member.summary: Description of what the field contains.

member.name: F:VRDR.IJEField.Priority
member.summary: Priority - lower will be "GET" and "SET" earlier.

member.name: T:VRDR.IJEMortality
member.summary: A "wrapper" class to convert between a FHIR based DeathRecord and a record in IJE Mortality format. Each property of this class corresponds exactly with a field in the IJE Mortality format. The getters convert from the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord to the IJE format for a specific field, and the setters convert from IJE format for a specific field and set that value on the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord.

member.name: F:VRDR.IJEMortality.dataLookup
member.summary: IJE data lookup helper. Thread-safe singleton!
